data:
no longer driven
by craving for excitement
real satisfaction

It was an old step van and the passenger seat wasn‚Äôt anchored. As my father drove, the seat slid forward then back then forward again. What a ride! I‚Äôm [guessing](https://ideas.joejenett.com/#shatters) I was about 10 or 11-years-old then based on the fact that Tony was with us in the van. He was a guy my father helped to immigrate from Cuba (in 1959?). We were on the way to [the bay](https://ideas.joejenett.com/#the%20bay).

The web has changed but there remain remnants of what it once was in terms of personal sites. I track some of those remnants, curating such sites (which are still active, or when I‚Äôm lucky, new), hoping to somehow keep my original vision of the web intact. It‚Äôs a tough road to drive on but I‚Äôve got a decent set of wheels with a few bells and whistles and more important, I enjoy the driving.
Riding that BMW down the highway, faring and all, sleep-deprived, he falls asleep.

Decades ago, I was one of the giggling twins standing and jumping up and down on the passenger seat next to our mother who was driving the little Nash Rambler. I think we were about 3 years old at the time and this is the earliest memory I‚Äôve managed to retain over the years.

‚ÄúWhy do you go away? So that you can come back. So that you can see the place you came from with new eyes and extra colors. And the people there see you differently, too. Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving.‚Äù - Terry Pratchett
40 years later, looking back, I realize that little has changed.
When we discovered Sliding Rock, we had not bathed for days camping up in the mountains. The cold plunge pool below was totally rejuvenating.

I‚Äôm convinced the thought that fills my mind most of the time is just a complex of [reactions](reactions.md) to the strange world I‚Äôm living in. Creative [urges](urges-1.md) struggle to redirect my mind to what I don‚Äôt see, to what might be.
I think ‚Äúthe future of awesome‚Äù really means ‚Äúnot quite awesome yet.‚Äù üòé
So. Need to carry on and make the best of my time.
Some stops in the journey border on unbearable but a new world is always just around the corner and when we‚Äôre lucky, it‚Äôs a better place.
